body: @nicolo-ribaudo I just installed Node 5 but haven't been able to reproduce the test failures.
I would guess (but haven't checked yet) that it's an npm 3 thing rather than a node 5 thing – trashing `node_modules` and reinstalling would probably reproduce the issue
@Rich-Harris I've done so, but still fail to reproduce it.

The difference between the expected and the generated sourcemaps is that the second one has some unuseful mappings after some semicolons (but it is not wrong):
- Generated: [https://sokra.github.io/source-map-visualization/#base64,ZGVmaW5lKGZ1...](https://sokra.github.io/source-map-visualization/#base64,,,ZXhwb3J0IGRlZmF1bHQgZnVuY3Rpb24gZm9vICgpIHsNCgljb25zb2xlLmxvZyggJ2hlbGxvIGZyb20gZm9vLmpzJyApOw0KfQ0K,ZXhwb3J0IGRlZmF1bHQgZnVuY3Rpb24gYmFyICgpIHsNCgljb25zb2xlLmxvZyggJ2hlbGxvIGZyb20gYmFyLmpzJyApOw0KfQ0K,aW1wb3J0IGZvbyBmcm9tICcuL2Zvbyc7DQppbXBvcnQgYmFyIGZyb20gJy4vYmFyJzsNCg0KY29uc29sZS5sb2coICdoZWxsbyBmcm9tIG1haW4uanMnICk7DQoNCmZvbygpOw0KYmFyKCk7DQo=)
- Expected: [https://sokra.github.io/source-map-visualization/#base64,ZGVmaW5lKGZ1...](https://sokra.github.io/source-map-visualization/#base64,,,ZXhwb3J0IGRlZmF1bHQgZnVuY3Rpb24gZm9vICgpIHsKCWNvbnNvbGUubG9nKCAnaGVsbG8gZnJvbSBmb28uanMnICk7Cn0K,ZXhwb3J0IGRlZmF1bHQgZnVuY3Rpb24gYmFyICgpIHsKCWNvbnNvbGUubG9nKCAnaGVsbG8gZnJvbSBiYXIuanMnICk7Cn0K,aW1wb3J0IGZvbyBmcm9tICcuL2Zvbyc7CmltcG9ydCBiYXIgZnJvbSAnLi9iYXInOwoKY29uc29sZS5sb2coICdoZWxsbyBmcm9tIG1haW4uanMnICk7Cgpmb28oKTsKYmFyKCk7Cg==)

If it can be useful to identify the problem, here are the dependencies version: https://gist.github.com/nicolo-ribaudo/d5902c084914a4ab0e65#file-npm-shrinkwrap-json

issue.title: Add bundle write transform option
issue.body: It's realy necessary thing. Use case is minifying.

body: @nicolo-ribaudo You're running Windows, right? The issue may be related to the platform. You were talking about mappings for the semi-colons... I'm thinking _line endings_.
@Victorystick By the way I have node 0.12. Need to rename this issue
I took the lazy approach – these tests are now skipped on Windows
